snippet: For some legal experts, the ruling provided more evidence that the Communist Party is preparing to modify a Mao-era extralegal judicial system that has become increasingly untenable.
abstract: Chinese court awards $429 to Tang Hui, mother of rape victime, as acknowledgement of official injustice; Tang had been sentenced to labor camp after demanding that men convicted of raping her daughter be more harshly punished; ruling provides more evidence that Chinese Communist Party is preparing to modify a Mao-era extralegal judicial system that has become increasingly untenable, both to bodies like the United Nations and the Chinese public. .

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo and Chen Jiehao contributed research.

lead_paragraph: For some legal experts, the ruling provided more evidence that the Communist Party is preparing to modify a Mao-era extralegal judicial system that has become increasingly untenable.

headline.main: Court Ruling Deals Public Blow to China’s Labor-Camp System
headline.print_headline: Court Ruling Deals a Blow to China’s Labor-Camp System
